articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Readers, I appear to have locked myself in self-referential language matrix trying to describe the feeling of playing top-down action shooter Kickback. You can only move through the recoil from shooting, you see, which means facing the opposite way to where you want to go. It’s both  very counterintuitive and very fun. To call something both counterintuitive and fun seems, well, counterintuitive. But also: fun. Which, as a concept is very fun to think about. But, also, quite counterintuitive. Writing such a incredibly redundant paragraph is quite fun, even though I’m just repeating myself. Counterintuitive, right? I’m going to try to escape this paragraph now. If I manage it, I’ll see you in the one below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Kickback is a cross between Doom: Eternal and the bouncing DVD logo

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
With an effectively infinite universe to fill in No Man’s Sky, developers Hello Games have certainly risen to the challenge of trying to fill it with as much stuff as they possibly can over the last near-decade, still managing to add major new features and modes eight years on from the sci-fi exploration game’s release. Next update Adrift is taking things right the way back, though, by emptying the expansive cosmos of almost everything except you, your ship and planets to visit.
Read more
articles.title: No Man’s Sky Adrift update leaves you completely alone in its universe, except for sandworms and ghost ships

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Tavern Keeper has been kicking around for a good number of years now, as Game Dev Tycoon developers Greenheart Games polished up their charming mixture of Dungeons & Dragons fantasy bartending with Theme Hospital-style sim management. Almost a decade from Game Dev Tycoon’s release, Tavern Keeper is now finally approaching its early access release later this year.
Read more
articles.title: Theme Hospital-like inn sim Tavern Keeper puts you in charge of a pub for fantasy adventurers straight out of D&D

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
A PC adapter for Sony’s PlayStation VR2 has recently popped up in South Korea, giving a new update - albeit an unofficial one - on the incoming PC support for the PS5 VR headset teased earlier this year.
Read more
articles.title: PlayStation VR2 PC adapter certification surfaces, marking one more step towards official support in 2024

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been a little while since we last heard about the untitled open-world driving game from Maverick Games, the studio opened a couple of years back by ex-Playground Games veterans including former Forza Horizon 5 creative director Mike Brown. We still don’t know what the team’s new game is called or when it might hit the road, but we have been given a few more snippets of what to expect and news on who’ll be helping pump up its tires and fill it with fuel as publisher.
Read more
articles.title: Ex-Forza Horizon devs and Skins co-creator want you to ‘fall in love with’ the characters in their story-led open-world driving game

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
We have been cursed with a terrible devouring monster. Each harvest, one villager must don the ceremonial, mildly magical mask, and enter the fields alone, to gather the precious life-giving ambrosia before the beast can befoul it. For five nights you must do battle, or evade its ravenous clutches.
Those of you who have known your own Devourer are surely thinking: Only five nights per year? Luxury. Harvest Hunt is good, though.
Read more
articles.title: Harvest Hunt gets decent mileage out of its hide and seek premise

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Many moons ago, premiere wordsman Nate Crowley reviewed shark ‘em up Maneater, decrying its incurious perpetuation of anti-shark propaganda, and calling it “an ecstatically violent simulation of being a fool's idea of a shark.” My own frothing penchant for the plan-schemes of Warhammer’s Skaven ratboys has been documented in these pages to the point of rabidity, but I do feel broadly similarly about media that sullies rats - clean, smart and good folk that they are. Lively tactics Trash Of The Titans does not aim to emancipate its villainous vermin. But, like Warhammer, it gets a pass for its evident affection towards its antagonistic dumpster diving scuttlers. Also, it's just plain fun.
 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy Tactics-like Trash Of The Titans dares you to be the garbage guzzling disaster mammal you always knew you were

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
A producer on Kerbal Space Program 2 has confirmed that those working on the space flight sim are being laid off en masse. We already knew that the developers at Intercept Games would be losing their jobs thanks to a closure announcement from Washington State. Until remarks from Strauss Zelnick, the CEO of Take-Two Interactive, muddied the waters. Zelnick refused to acknowledge that the studio was being closed when asked by a reporter, even going so far as to claim the opposite. "We didn't shutter those studios," he told IGN. But it seems clear from one producer's testimony that Zelnick's remarks are inaccurate. 
Read more
articles.title: Kerbal Space Program 2 producer confirms mass layoffs, contradicting CEO's remarks

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
A new earnings report from The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt makers CD Projekt Red has revealed that the follow-up to the sorceress-courting, Nekker-thwacking, horse-reassuring RPG is currently being worked on by around 400 people, and plans to move into the production phase by the “second half of the year.” Elsewhere, the report shows that the studio’s previous RPG, Cyberpunk 2077 officially ended all development at the end of April, at which time the remaining 17 staff still tweaking that game’s ray-traced chewing gum foil moved on to the Witcher 4 , or ‘Polaris’, as they keep insisting it's called.
 
Read more
articles.title: Cyberpunk 2077’s development has officially ended as The Witcher 4 Polaris moves into production

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Well, it’s been a long hard road, but since I vowed to only consume alcohol matured while having game soundtracks forcibly blasted into its molecules, giving up drinking has been a lot easier. Now, to take the final gulp of my Snake Eater-theme-reared IPA, and open up my web browser….
Read more
articles.title: Sorry, I only drink wine that was aged listening to the Nier Automata soundtrack now

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I have played many a creepy throwback game that takes inspiration from the ever inadequately named "Golden" (Grimy and Diseased? Cadaverous, perhaps) Age of survival horror on PS1, but it's rare you play one that invokes the N64, and even less often that you stumble on something horror-adjacent that riffs on Star Fox 64. Ah, Star Fox! The natural companion piece for, say, Eternal Darkness or The Suffering. In fairness, I did always find those Pez dispenser dialogue animations pretty eerie.

 
Read more
articles.title: Death In Abyss is a creepy submarine action game in which your ship does the backstroke

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
To kick off with some extremely half-arsed mytho-geometry, the original Frostpunk was a testament to both the design utility and the inexhaustible political symbolism of circles. When people wish to found a community of equals they commonly form a circle, with each participant visible and audible to the rest. A circle is also the best shape for defending against an engulfing ambient threat such as a global ice age, because it has no weak points, and it makes a great centrepiece for a videogame interface, a symmetrical motif that can be tuned and adorned to either suck your attention into the screen or distribute it evenly in all directions.
Created by Polish developers 11 bit, Frostpunk takes place in the middle of a circle, an Arctic crater with a huge coal generator at its heart. Your city rises in rings around that generator, each additional layer of dwellings corresponding intuitively to decreasing temperature, and the result is one of the most focused and thematically consistent specimens of its genre - a building game that feels as intimate and urgent as tending a campfire. Frostpunk 2's new campaign mode breaks the circle open. It starts where you (hopefully) ended, with the crater now fully colonised and evolved into a glaring, blue-orange geode of high-density housing and clustered chimneys. But the view has been pulled back, and construction now unfolds along the plains and canyons beyond the crater, which consist not of circles but of hexagons - another UI designer's favourite - on which you'll plot out upgradeable districts rather than assembling individual buildings. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Frostpunk 2 will live or die by its faction voting mechanic, and the biggest faction of all is Twitch

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The first scene in RPS Game Club pick Deathbulge: Battle Of The Bands - a genuinely funny and innovative riff on turn-based RPGs -  sees candyfloss n’ superglue-haired guitarist Faye frantically search for her missing guitar as the crowd for the titular battle grow impatient. You’ll quickly realise this a school-with-no-trousers-esque dream sequence, but the matted mess of thick black cables that carpet this dingy side-stage is painfully accurate. Pissing around with gear is roughly 70% of the band experience, in my limited experience of being in bands. This probably changes when you’ve got roadies or dedicated tech people, but we did not, because we were skint. And also terrible. Several hours of Deathbulge has brought me more joy than several years of being in actual bands. I had some isolated good times in some of those bands, but I’m having a very good time with Deathbulge.
 
Read more
articles.title: Deathbulge: Battle Of The Bands is roughly 1000% more fun than being in an actual band

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
A whopping 1000 corpses have been found in our ongoing investigation into Anthology of the Killer, Rock Paper Shotgun can reveal. The bodies were discovered in the aforementioned murder mystery "video game", which is out now on itch.io. Following our previous reports we can confirm that exposure to the game's crime-infested city can cause severe disorientation, confusion, uncontrolled fits of laughter, and moderate enlightenment. The streets here are so dense with crime that entire apartment blocks must shutter at night. When Rock Paper Shotgun reported the 1000 corpses to detectives, we were told this was "normal" and "appropriate".
Read more
articles.title: Anthology of the Killer is out now, bringing murder to your doorstep

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 will be the first Call Of Duty to launch on Microsoft Game Pass, according to a notification that went out this morning via the Xbox Game Pass app for iPhone and Android. "Just announced: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is coming to Game Pass on day one later this year!" it reads. Sounds like a solid confirmation from me, though Microsoft and Activision have yet to start bellowing the news from any of Call of Duty’s official pulpits.
 Read more
articles.title: Microsoft announce Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Game Pass launch alongside teaser trailer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In the vast Wuthering Waves-shaped shadow that has descended across gaming comes an announcement from HoYoverse, publishers of quite large gacha gubbins 'em up, Genshin Impact. The studio's follow-up Zenless Zone Zero is now set to release on July 4th. For anyone who hasn't yet heard of the bright cyberpunk character action game, I guess now's your chance to look at the slick anime visuals in the new trailer below and go "hmmm", with either a songful note of eye-widening interest or the suspicious rumble of a free-to-play skeptic.  Your choice.
Read more
articles.title: Zenless Zone Zero gets a release date of July 4th, plus a trailer with lots of kicking

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Resident Evils Code Veronica and 0 will be the next entries in the survival horror series to get the remake treatment, according to rumours. “A remake of Resident Evil Zero & Code Veronica in development right now,” claimed user Dusk Golem on Le Epic Musk Zone. The claim was casually corroborated by trustworthy sort Andy Robinson of VGC. Note the wording here, which suggests a bundle package of sorts, similar to the rumoured original plan for the remakes of Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3.
 
Read more
articles.title: Resident Evil Code Veronica and 0 remakes are rumoured to be in development at Capcom

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
At intervals in our relentless battles with the Maw, we lose people. Sometimes, it's because those people have succeeded in levelling up out of games journalism, or found their way into another echelon of the craft. Other times, the losses are more abrupt and arbitrary. In each case, one short term response is intensification. Those of us who remain must be rockier, paperier and more shotgun than ever before. With that in mind, here are this (four-day) week's new PC games of note.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Maw - 28th May-1st June 2024

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been three years to the day since we learned that Square Enix planned to remake Dragon Quest 3, unveiling a revamping of the seminal 1988 JRPG in Octopath Traveler’s HD-2D engine. Three years have passed since then, but we’ve finally had an update on the remake - and it’s raised a few questions, to say the least.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Quest 3 remake might bring the whole Erdrick trilogy to HD-2D, if a fresh tease from Square Enix is anything to go by

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The next Doom game - the first new instalment in over four years, after Doom Eternal - is reportedly taking a leaf out of Evil Dead: Army of Darkness’ necronomicon by transporting the Doom Slayer back to a medieval world to presumably battle hellspawn. According to a new report, it’s subtitled The Dark Ages and we’ll get an official reveal next week.
Read more
articles.title: The next Doom game is apparently called The Dark Ages and will go all Army of Darkness in a medieval world

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The director of Baldur's Gate 3 and CEO of developers Larian has revealed that the studio experienced crunch in order to get the sprawling Dungeons & Dragons CRPG finished. While Swen Vincke admitted that “it would be a lie to say that we didn't [crunch]”, he insisted that it was less than on past Larian games such as Divinity, staff were paid for the overtime and it seemingly didn’t go as far as working late nights or weekends (for the most part, anyway).
Read more
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 had “a bit” of crunch, as director claims that will “always” be the case to get games finished

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The sheer number and scale of video games released nowadays means that the infamous Steam backlog is better-fed than ever, gorging on half-played hundred-hour RPGs, never-touched indies amassed during summer sales and “I’ll get to it one day” PC pipe dreams. If you were hoping to task your descendants with continuing your quest to get all 1,700-plus achievements in Tales of Maj'Eyal or maintain your ranked leaderboard position in Dota 2, bad news: it turns out that you can’t pass on your Steam library after you die.
Read more
articles.title: You can’t leave your Steam backlog to someone else in your will

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Of course, regular readers will know that 'book' was actually the name of the doctor, but that's beside the point. This week, it's Syphilisation and The Quiet Sleep developer and RPS contributor, Nikhil Murthy! Cheers Nikhil! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf? 
 
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Syphilisation and The Quiet Sleep's Nikhil Murthy

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are a day that arrives at the end of the week. Sometimes those weeks bring joy, and sometimes they bring uncertainity. That's fine. There's another one tommorow. Before that new week begins, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
It's been a week. Possibly, a three-day weekend of rest and games will do us all some good. And maybe by the end of it, it'll be a new week. Here's what we'll be clicking on this bank holiday weekend.
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Wuthering Waves is the latest open-world RPG gacha game to follow in the wake of the likes of Genshin Impact and Honkai: Star Rail, but Kuro Games’ free-to-play offering has had to deal with a bit of a wobbly launch over the last couple of days, leading the studio to scramble to address login problems, detail additional upcoming improvements and offer players some in-game games as means of apology.
Read more
articles.title: Wuthering Waves plans to let you skip more scenes and improve combat as gacha RPG apologises for rocky launch

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The Sims 4 is fast approaching its 10th birthday this September, a fact that genuinely instilled me with the crushing sense of time marching relentlessly on when I checked its release date a moment ago. That near-decade has brought a whole heap of additions, expansions, packs and updates to the enduring life sim game, to the degree that the underlying tech serving as the foundation for dozens of later mechanical and visual elements can sometimes look a bit wobbly these days.
Read more
articles.title: Sims 4 devs assemble team to focus on fixing bugs and upping performance, updates to now land every two months

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
In a year already stacking up plates of delicious indie game dishes so fast they’re toppling over and crashing onto the floor, spilling splattered food over the carpet to be hoovered up by waiting dogs/cats/raccoons/mice, Animal Well is one of the most generous helpings yet. The captivating, combat-free Metroidvania is rich with a delectable buffet of challenges, puzzles and secrets to find even once you’ve seen the credits roll. Still, players have chewed their way through its more-ish platforming and puzzle-solving much faster than its solo developer intended, it turns out. Luckily for us all, creator Billy Basso is already looking ahead to a new game set in the moody zoo-niverse - even if that’s not a complete sequel.
Read more
articles.title: Animal Well creator plans to follow the superb Metroidvania with a game that shares its world but “may not be a direct sequel”

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Slovak studio 3Division’s city-building strategy sim Workers & Resources: Soviet Republic will leave early access on 20th June 2024 – a welcome blast of no-nonsense, planned-economy Soviet realism in the wake of the decadent capitalist theatrics of Summer Games Fest. Here’s a triumphal trailer with many a joyful image of high-density housing and locomotives in the snow.
Read more
articles.title: One-of-a-kind strategy sim Workers & Resources: Soviet Republic gets 1.0 release next month

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
We've known for some time that Fallout was coming to Fortnite, we just weren't entirely sure in what capacity. Well, now we know that this season's wasteland offerings take the form of a sort of Mad Max meets Fallout meets Borderlands- battle royale affair. There's a big emphasis on deserts and vehicles, basically, with highlights including: mechanical fists, turrets on cars, and the possibility of manning one of two War Buses that patrol the reworked map.
Read more
articles.title: Fortnite's new season adds War Buses, rocket-propelled fists, and a lawless desert biome

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Calling it now: this is the least intriguing article you will read about 11 bit's The Alters, a blend of Danny Boyle's Sunshine and Duncan Jones's Moon in which (deep breath) you are a marooned space engineer who must spawn different versions of himself by means of backstory-branching gadgetry in order to operate an enormous, rolling base and escape the apocalyptic rays of the local sun. 


We're not going to talk about any of that hoity-toity quantum wheeling-and-dealing in this piece, however. We're going to talk about the fact that the opening stretch reminded me of Gears Of War and the many over-the-shoulder adventures it has influenced. I'm sorry. It's been a complicated week involving minimal sleep, and I no longer have the grey cells for branching timelines, though they are certainly the more fascinating aspect of this game.
 
Read more
articles.title: The opening hour of The Alters feels like 11 bit's first third-person narrative action game

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
In one of the better gaming trends of the last few years, we appear to have entered a golden age for booting the crud out of doors. There’s Deathbulge of course, but also the upcoming Anger Foot, Abiotic Factor, and a load more I’m sure. There was also literally Door Kickers, but that was ages ago. Anyway, the latest game to put a hinge-disrespecting protagonist front and center is also my current obsession: the excellent Post Void/Hotline Miami-type beat, Mullet Mad Jack. It’s a very fast, very silly FPS about shooting robot billionaires that takes its aesthetic from 80’s anime and PC-98 games. I’m not sure what else you need, honestly.
 
Read more
articles.title: If you happen to be a touch miffed at faceless corps, Mullet Mad Jack has the antidote

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I cannot compare my experience of writing a review for The Splintered Sea, the first paid expansion for dastardly clever physics puzzle builder Besiege, to that of a journaling sailor facing lethal storms on the horizon. Still, if we take for granted the idea that a review is only really valuable as an insight into the experience of the player: I haven’t been feeling especially great this week. That in mind: Splintered Sea is more Besiege, thoughtfully applied to its already expansive toolkit. More importantly, it's currently bringing me deep and deeply needed moments of untainted, childlike, vaguely-Orkish joy.
Read more
articles.title: Besiege: The Splintered Sea review: a small vessel for expansive seafaring

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Activision have celebrated my birthday in the traditional manner by announcing a new Call Of Duty game. Said Call Of Duty game is Black Ops 6, "a dark new chapter" in the Treyarch-helmed FPS sub-series which is known for seedier and weirder, alt-historical or post-future stories featuring hallucinations and cybernetics and catchy period music.
  
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty 2024 revealed as Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6, "a dark new chapter"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Asus ROG Ally X, a sort of semi-sequel to last year’s ROG Ally handheld PC, has had its specs spilled over at Videocardz. I’m usually a lot more suspicious of hardware leaks, which are often just out-of-date or otherwise inaccurate info, but I’ve also sat through enough mic-muted prebriefings to know an official slideshow when I see one, and that appears to be exactly what Videocardz got its hands on. Besides, these specs include a gigantic 80Whr battery upgrade (doubling the ROG Ally’s 40Whr capacity), so we can at least file this under "News James wants to be true."
Read more
articles.title: Looks like the Asus ROG Ally X will get a honking great battery upgrade

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Skulls! You’ve got one. I’ve got one. Everybody has a lovely skull keeping their lovely face right where it should be. Warhammer is big, so it needs must have multiple of them, hence their yearly event Skulls, which collates a bunch of Games Workshop related announcements into a sort of bizzaro world Nintendo Direct if Yoshi was actually a parasitic corpse emperor. There’s usually at least a few game announcements in there, and this year was a bumper. The headline announcement being an upcoming sequel to well-loved space-pope turn-based strategy Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus. Yes, yes. I’m getting to the dog.
 
Read more
articles.title: Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus is getting a sequel and Total War: Warhammer 3 is getting a big red dog

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Videogames and especially role-playing games are chock-full of sheltered upbringings that go tits up. Innocent times and places like the prologue for Baldur's Gate, which unfolds in the vast, fortified monastery of Candlekeep (beware spoilers from this point on).
BioWare's first ever RPG opens with your unsuspecting Chosen One learning the ropes from the old sage Gorion. There are fetchquests that take you around the enormous citadel, bits of combat training to do, cosy formative chinwags to have with characters like your childhood friend Imoen. But it's not to last, of course: Gorion is murdered, and you must rove the Sword Coast in pursuit of his killer. When you return to Candlekeep later in the game, this once-proud bastion of learning has been filled with doppelgangers of Gorion and other acquaintances, a parade of chatbots waiting to stab you in the back.
 
Read more
articles.title: How Baldur's Gate 3 might have brought back Candlekeep, the library fortress where Baldur's Gate began

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
While I’ve always thought the race towards graphical hyperrealism isn’t as pervasive as it's often perceived, Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is definitely one of those games. The kind that probably has twelve artists dedicated to the recreation of visible pores, that sort of thing. It’s so focused on looking pretty that it hasn’t even noticed the title and subtitle got mixed up.
Sure enough, Hellblade 2 is a harsh test for older hardware, with a heavy reliance on DLSS or FSR upscaling to keep performance sweet. That said, it’s no Dragons Dogma 2-style technical horrorshow either. A happy balance of visuals and smoothness is attainable on plush PCs and low-end laptops alike, while DLSS 3 frame generation can deliver an effective kick in the framerate pants on RTX 40 series GPUs.
Read more
articles.title: Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is less of a PC hardware-killer than it looks

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In Anthology of the Killer you do not exit the game using a pause menu. You exit it by walking down a back alley into the quavering arms of two hungry bears. This is just one of many laughs your diaphragm will endure as you navigate "the escalating adventures of a girl trying to make zines in a town of giallo-style masked serial murderers". The horror comedy already won its creators the Nuovo Award at the Independent Games Festival this year, recognition that has been a long time coming for prolific game maker Stephen "thecatamites" Gillmurphy. If you're unfamiliar with his work, you can get acquainted next week, when Anthology of the Killer gets its full release on Itch.io on May 28th.  At which point you can explore its unsettling urban hell of shady corporations and cops who think they're cool. There's a trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: 'Don't worry! I'm a murderer!'  - award-winning comedy Anthology of the Killer is out next week

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Sometimes you gotta know when to fold, and trying to get new hotness RPG Wuthering Waves to play nice with the Steam Deck has got me creasing like an origami crane. While its Epic Games Store release can be worked around, and Proton GE will get the game’s own launcher running, no combination of software, compatibility tools, or installation folder deep-diving seems capable of actually booting the game proper.
As such, I’m accepting defeat. Obviously with apologies to any studious Steam Deck Academy readers.
Read more
articles.title: Wuthering Waves really, really doesn’t want to run on Steam Deck

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Everything And Then The Licensed Kitchen Sink fighting game MultiVersus returns next week after an almost year-long self-imposed post-beta exile. With the decision to pull the game from sale and turn off its servers for months on end after allowing people to sink their real-life money into unlocking costumes and such (with no refunds), its developers are now looking to seemingly give something back in return.
Read more
articles.title: You’ll get Warner Bros brawler MultiVersus’ premium battle pass for free if you played the beta

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
The classic anime series Gundam examines the traumatic experience of war, particularly the unalterable effect it has on those young soldiers forced to participate in the horrors of fighting for their life while taking the lives of others using weapons of inhuman strength and devastation. Which clearly makes it the perfect fit for a bit of upcoming DLC for military-fetishising interactive gun range Call of Duty.
Read more
articles.title: Call of Duty is getting in the (Gundam) robot

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
We already know that a full-blown sequel to swampy extraction shooter Hunt: Showdown probably isn’t on the cards right now, but developers Crytek appear to be lining up the next major update for the 2019 PvPvE cryptid-slayer as almost a whole new game regardless.
Read more
articles.title: Hunt: Showdown’s massive summer update isn’t Hunt 2, but the “significant relaunch” marks “a whole new era”

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
In a twist of fate I've mentioned in some recent Destiny 2 news posts, I am fully back into Destiny. Former vidbud Liam and I used it, initially, as something we could do while catching up on life. But now? Now we're all in. Liam has created a spreadsheet of things we're ticking off to prepare for the upcoming expansion, and I think it's the perfect summation of what the game is to us: something that makes no sense at all and yet something that makes our brains hum with happiness.
And what we've found with Destiny, in all of its bloat, is that we haven't explored for a single second since our return. Everything is accomplished through menus, making it quite Starfield-esque, which is terrible… but also good. We can't make sense of it and we don't think we ever will.
Read more
articles.title: Destiny 2 is mighty lucky it has good shooting because it's impenetrable otherwise

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I'm not sure it's even worth that, to be honest. Messed my back up a right old treat. 
 
Read more
articles.title: You can get my old battered gamer chair for, oh I dunno, 50 quid?

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description: Graphics... cards? Cards. House of cards. House of... graphics cards?
articles.title: Screw it, I'm building a house of graphics cards

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Hauntii sets the scene with a rather magical opening sequence. A beam of light shoots out of a mysterious planet and a zoom in reveals the beam to be an asteroid, but not just any asteroid: a crystal shaped like a teardrop, with a little ghost nestled inside. You awaken as this little ghost, who it turns out, has crash landed in Eternity (and who, it turns out, is called Hauntii). Soon you bump into a ghostly girl, who guides you to a tower that thrusts you both up to a higher plane - but though she ascends, you're dragged back to the bottom at the last moment by some netherworldly chains. And so, as Hauntii you travel through Eternity to discover who that girl was and, ultimately, how to ascend to those heavenly skies yourself.
Read more
articles.title: Hauntii review: an adventure as beautiful as it looks

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description: PC gaming news, previews, reviews, opinion.
articles.title: Why do game cutscenes always fade to white?: a sincere plea on behalf of the mole people

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
At RPS we like Alices. When somebody comes along with the name "Alice" you don't just say "oh hi" like some insolent rube. You nod with solemn respect and you say, "Alice". An Alice is someone you should not take lightly, nor take for granted, nor leave unmonitored. For they will destroy worlds and build better ones while you are not looking. This is dangerous and exciting. Alices are a force to be reckoned with. To treat an Alice poorly is to invite shame, dishonour, and contempt. Here are some of the best Alices in video games!
Read more
articles.title: The best Alices in PC games

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
We just got a new Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree story trailer yesterday. As is their druthers, FromSoft have at once made the events it depicts feel of earth-shattering importance while providing basically no concrete information. A lot of people will be putting out gargantuan theory posts right now, rambling on about Miquella, the Crucible, the Golden Order blah blah. This is all a distraction. Anyone with eyes can tell you that the primary movers and shakers of this final chapter in the Lands Between are a secret faction of hitherto secret spear people. You're likely confused, and that's understandable. As the foremost authority on ephemeral nonsense in Elden Ring, I’m the only one who has your back here.
 
Read more
articles.title: Here’s every spear I spotted in the new Elden Ring DLC trailer, rated for their predicted plot relevance

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The music in haunting 2D adventure Norco was so good it’s one of the few soundtracks I’ve actually bought on Steam, so I’m deeply intrigued to learn that developer Geography of Robots are putting music - and dancing - front and center in the new demo for their next project, Silenus. You can bop your way between screens, reader!
 
Read more
articles.title: Norco makers’ new game Silenus lets you boogie in a gothic industrial hellscape

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Malý)
articles.description: Společnost Zabbix SIA vydala 4. června 2024 novou dlouho očekávanou LTS verzi monitorovacího systému Zabbix. Čerstvě uvolněný Zabbix 7.0.0 LTS, přináší mnoho nových vlastností, které si dnes podrobněji popíšeme.
articles.title: Nový Zabbix 7.0 LTS: HA podpora Zabbix proxy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si převedeme obrázky do jiných formátů, prohlédneme si galerii z iOS Live Photos, zkonvertujeme si dokumenty a vytvoříme si ikony pro Windows a macOS.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (5. 6. 2024): konvertujte obrázky nebo třeba dokumenty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Měli jste někdy disketovku k osmibitu? Já taky ne, proto jsem si ji pořídil teď. V dnešním článku se zaměříme na zlepšení vzhledu plastů a krátce se podíváme na samotnou desku elektroniky a co obsahuje.
articles.title: Commodore 1541-II – retrobrighting a pohled na elektroniku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Už dříve jsme se seznámili se zajímavým funkcionálním jazykem Coconut, který je transpilován do Pythonu. Coconut se ovšem neustále vyvíjí a vyvíjí se i samotný Python, takže nastal čas Coconut oprášit.
articles.title: Coconut: jazyk naznačující směr budoucího vývoje Pythonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: V tomto vydání Postřehů z bezpečnosti se podíváme na rozbití botnetu 911 S5, skupinu APT28 a malware HeadLace nebo kombinaci špionážních a ransomwarových TTPs severokorejskou skupinou.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: FBI rozbila botnet 911 S5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Ubuntu 24.04 je nyní k dispozici pro jednodeskový počítač Milk-V Mars RISC-V. Fedora Engineering Steering Committee (FESCo) schválil jednohlasně Fedora Miracle spin jako oficiální edici Fedory.
articles.title: Ubuntu na Marsu s RISC-V, schválen nový spin Fedory

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Kdenlive 24.05 přináší Multi-Format Rendering a automatický překlad titulků, nová verze dav1d 1.4.2, Godot 4.3 Beta 1 s podporou nativního běhu na Waylandu, vývojová verze Wine 9.10.
articles.title: Další firmwary pro RDNA3+ Radeony. Krita slaví 25 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Seznam.cz otevřel nové datové centrum Kokura 3. Budova přiléhá k jeho prvnímu datacentru v Horních Počernicích a ukazuje, kam se technologie za uplynulou dekádu posunuly. Projděte se s námi zbrusu novou budovou.
articles.title: Seznam.cz otevřel datacentrum Kokura 3: má moderní chlazení a vyšší kapacitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nastavitelná komprese boot obrazu pro RISC-V, XFS a vylepšený Online Repair, další vylepšení P-State u AMD a Intelu či obecně ACPI, Btrfs norecovery v jiné podobě, novinky u Compute Express Link.
articles.title: Btrfs opět s norecovery, CXL s podporou Resetu a další novinky pro jádro 6.10

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek Lorenzův systém: ideální pomůcka pro studium chaosu dnes navážeme. Pokusíme se totiž popsat si některé další dynamické systémy s podivným atraktorem, které je možné vykreslit ve 2D rovině či v 3D prostoru.
articles.title: Od Lorenzova atraktoru k dalším typům atraktorů v ploše i prostoru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical upozorňuje, že Ubuntu 23.10 Mantic Minotaur dosáhne 11. července konce životnosti a přestane tedy dostávat bezpečnostní záplaty. Společnost zároveň vyzvala uživatele, aby přešli na novější vydání Ubuntu. Aktuálním vydáním je Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat.
articles.title: Příští měsíc skončí podpora Ubuntu 23.10 Mantic Minotaur

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical oznámil Ubuntu Core 24, nejnovější stabilní verzi oficiální verze Ubuntu optimalizovanou pro internet věcí (Internet of Things) a vestavěná zařízení používající architekturu ARM, X86 nebo RISC-V. Jde o kontejnerizovanou variantu Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat s plně preemptivním jádrem, které časově předvidatelné reakce a umožňuje využívat pokročilé funkce v reálném čase na certifikovaném hardwaru Ubuntu od partnerů společnosti Canonical.
articles.title: Canonical vydal Ubuntu Core 24 pro IoT a vestavěná zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Máte spravovat síťové prvky společnosti MikroTik, ale chybí vám potřebné znalosti a zkušenosti? Přijďte na naše školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a kromě všech důležitých informací si domů odnesete i vlastní router MikroTik.
articles.title: Přijďte na školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a odnesete si router

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Intel odhalil některé další technické detaily o svém připravovaném procesoru Lunar Lake. Půjde o novou generací mobilních procesorů Core Ultra, která navazuje na loňský Meteor Lake. Bude mít dva typy jader: efektivní E-jádra a výkonná P-jádra. Intel také prozradil, že půjde o kombinaci 4E+4P s vypnutým hyper-threadingem. Přidělování jednotlivých úloh závisí na operačním systému, jehož plánovač musí v reálném čase provádět úpravy nastavení vyvažující efektivitu s výpočetním výkonem v závislosti na intenzitě pracovní zátěže.
articles.title: Intel představuje architekturu Lunar Lake s pamětí integrovanou v procesoru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšlo první desetinkové vydání v řadě FreeBSD 14. Verze 14.1 přidává implementaci SIMD zpracování řetězců a paměťových operací na amd64 v knihovně C pro zvýšení výkonu, vylepšení zvukového systému, například podporu hotplug zařízení. K dispozici je také nejnovější verze OpenZFS, clang/llvm a OpenSSH.
articles.title: Vyšlo FreeBSD 14.1

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojář Debianu Luca Boccassi pracuje na podpoře systemd-boot místo klasického bootloaderu Grub. Existující patche implementují podporu v expertním režimu instalace a lze předpokládat, že postupem prací nakonec Debian tuto možnost jednoho dne nabídne i běžnému uživateli.
articles.title: Debian nabídne v expertním režimu podporu systemd-boot

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Výchozí nastavení linuxové distribuce Mint je nově takové, že nepodporuje instalaci aplikací v podobě neověřených Flatpaků. Jde o úpravu instalačního programu Linux Mint Software Manager / mintinstall, který vedle této změny je nyní svižnější a rychleji se uživateli načte. Uživatel samozřejmě má možnost neověřené Flatpaky instalovat na vlastní riziko.
articles.title: Linux Mint vypnul neověřené Flatpaky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Raspberry Pi dnes oznámilo AI Kit pro Raspberry 5, který je složen z oficiálního M.2 HATu a AI akcelerátoru Hailo-8L, který je právě určen do M.2 slotu. Ten má výkon 13 TOPS a typickou spotřebu 1,5 W. Celková cena je 70 dolarů (u nás 1979 korun). Hailo s Raspberry Pi 4 bylo i v chytrém světle na kolo, o kterém jsme před časem psali.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi AI Kit s 13 TOPS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Vyšel očekávaný Zabbix 7.0 LTS. Mezi hlavní novinky patří nové widgety, rozšířená dostupnost widgetů v šablonách, Zabbix Proxy v režimu vysoké dostupnosti (HA), nový item browser a rozšířená možnost úprav uživatelských médií u JIT.
articles.title: Právě byl vydán Zabbix 7.0 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google zřejmě omylem zveřejnil v jednom z repozitářů na GitHubu velkou várku interních technických dokumentů, které částečně popisují, jak vyhledávač hodnotí webové stránky. SEO komunita je nadšená, že může nahlédnout za oponu, a zároveň se bouří, protože dokumenty zjevně odporují některým informacím, které Google v minulosti zveřejnil.
articles.title: Google omylem na GitHubu zveřejnil interní dokumentaci k vyhledávači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po šesti letech vyšla nová verze editoru dokumentů LyX s označením 2.4.0. LyX je desktopová aplikace typu WYSIWYM (What You See Is What You Mean), která nabízí grafickou úpravu dokumentů LaTeX s importem a exportem do formátů PDF, HTML, OpenDocument, Word a dalších.
articles.title: LyX 2.4.0 přináší podporu formátů EPUB a DocBook 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Kaspersky minulý týden vydal bezplatný nástroj Virus Removal Tool pro Linux. Stejný nástroj vydává pro Windows a nyní je dostupný i pro Linux x86_64. Nástroj pouze prohledává zvolené soubory a adresáře na viry. Nedělá žádnou detekci v reálném čase.
articles.title: Kaspersky vydal bezplatný Virus Removal Tool pro Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno jsme představili kontroverzní funkci Recall z Windows 11, která bude dělat snímky obrazovky a za vás si pamatovat vše, co jste na počítači dělali. Recall by měl fungovat jenom na Copilot+PC s dostatečně výkonným NPU (40 TOPS).
articles.title: AI pomocníka Recall je možné na ARM64 zapnout i pro nedpoporované CPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na veletrhu Computex 2024 AMD představilo Ryzen 9000 s architekturou Zen5. Procesory budou na trhu od července. Procesory by měly být zhruba o 16 % rychlejší než Zen4 na stejné frekvenci.
articles.title: AMD představilo Ryzen 9000 pro desktop s architekturou Zen5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Pokud chcete provozovat Kubernetes na vlastním hardware, Rancher je jednoduchý a efektivní způsob, jak toho docílit. Umožní vám jednoduše vytvořit a spravovat Kubernets cluster na vlastních virtuálních serverech. Používat Rancher se naučíte na dalším školení Rancher – Kubernetes na vlastním hardware, které proběhne 17. a 18. června a uskuteční se hybridně, tedy v naší pražské školicí místnosti a zároveň online.
articles.title: Rancher: provozujte Kubernetes na vlastním hardware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Do Gentoo a NetBSD je nově zakázáno přispívat zdrojovým kódem, který napsala umělá inteligence. Je to ze dvou důvodů: obava o bezpečnost a také nejasná licence takového kódu.
articles.title: Debian se zatím proti AI nevyhrazuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Blíží se léto, chladiče topí, tranzistory se přehřívají, novinářům pomalu docházejí témata a nastává klasická okurková sezóna. Je tomu tak i mezi bastlíři? Na to se podíváme na Virtuální Bastlírně!
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 39: Co za elektroniku nacpete do velikosti vizitky?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na Steamu je možné zdarma získat hru Tell Me Why. Jde o adventuru o dvou sourozencích, kteří pomocí superschopností zjišťují, co se událo v jejich minulosti.
articles.title: Hra Tell Me Why na Steamu zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: YouTuber Albino si stěžuje na automatickou kontrolu autorských práv na YouTube. Když streamoval Fallout, jeho pračka Samsung dokončila cyklus a zahrála melodii. Tato melodie byla vyhodnocena jako porušení autorských práv, protože se shoduje s nahrávkou od uživatele Audego starou devět let. Což je vlastně přesně nahraná melodie pračky Samsung. Ke klipu však Audego připojil Content ID, tedy označil jej za vlastní výtvor.
articles.title: Pračka, YouTube a autorská práva

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Andrei Kvapil)
articles.description: Vývojáři svobodné platformy Cozystack (PaaS) vydali nástroj Talm, jehož účelem je zjednodušit konfiguraci serverů s Talos Linuxem, operačním systémem pro nasazení Kubernetes, který má podobné API jako samotné Kubernetes. Přestože byl Talm původně vytvořen pro deklarativní instalaci Cozystack, není specificky vázán na tuto platformu a lze ho použít pro správu jakýchkoliv konfigurací Talos Linuxu.
articles.title: Projekt Cozystack vydal Talm, manažer konfigurací pro Talos Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V kompresním programu XZ byla před dvěma měsíci objevena šikovně skrytá zadní vrátka CVE-2024–3094. Teoreticky by je bylo možné vzdáleně zneužít přes SSH a knihovnu liblzma, která je součástí XZ. Škodlivé byly verze 5.6 a 5.6.1. Ve středu vyšlo XZ 5.6.2 s již odstraněnými zadními vrátky.
articles.title: Vyšlo XZ 5.6.2 s odstraněnými zadními vrátky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Google se drží svého plánu postupně ukončit starší rozšíření pro Chrome, které používají „Manifest V2“. Začne s tím už 3. června, přičemž se to nejprve dotkne vývojářského kanálu Dev a Canary. Uživatelům se budou rozšíření vypínat postupně a vše by mělo být hotovo na začátku příštího roku.
articles.title: Google začne za několik dní vypínat starší rozšíření pro Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Simon Ser vydal Wayland 1.23, který přináší drobná vylepšení, opravy chyb a vylepšení protokolu Wayland. Nová verze není příliš zajímavá pro uživatele, ale vývojářům by se mohlo hodit několik nových API, vylepšené rozhraní pro ladění a podobně.
articles.title: Wayland nabízí podporu pro OpenBSD

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical oznámil dostupnost real-time jádra pro nedávné vydané Ubuntu 24.04 LTS Noble Numbat. To zajišťuje, aby byly procesy s vysokou prioritou spuštěny jako první a s deterministickou dobou odezvy. Ve srovnání s běžným jádrem tak nabízí výrazně nižší latenci a dovoluje systému bezpečně zpracovávat časově citlivé operace.
articles.title: Canonical představil real-time jádro pro Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Chcete se stát forenzním specialistou? Tak je tu pro vás školení Forenzní trénink II., které pořádá sdružení CESNET ve dnech 13. a 14. června v Praze. Dvoudenní školení rozvíjí základy představené v předchozím školení Forenzní trénink 1: Úvod do forenzní analýzy, konkrétně v oblasti analýzy síťového provozu.
articles.title: Školení Forenzní trénink II. - poslední volná místa

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová řada notebooků TravelMate AI. Největším rizikem pro poskytovatele řízených služeb i jejich klienty je nedostatek dovedností v oblasti kybernetické bezpečnosti. Do Česka přichází Farseer, slibuje revoluci ve finančním plánování. Příliš mnoho výstrah a zvětšující se stínové IT narušují firemní bezpečnost. Vývojáři musí řešit problémy aplikací, místo aby vytvářeli nové. Digitální dvojčata se stávají nezbytností. Dell zvyšuje výkon, odolnost a efektivitu úložiště PowerStore. Brainware – co to vůbec je?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Vývojáři musí řešit problémy aplikací, místo aby vytvářeli nové

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Poprvé změřili rotaci supermasivní černé díry. Původ magnetického pole Slunce by se mohl nacházet blízko povrchu. Chirální fonony dokážou opravdová kouzla. Žebříček superpočítačů Green500.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz:  Postoupili ve snaze najít kvantovou povahu gravitace

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už hledáte levnější způsob jak postavit nový počítač, nebo jen upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato nabídka na Goodoffer24.com vám určitě pomůže, protože je skvělá, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Zvláštní slevy na software v pololetí, Windows 11 za €20 a mnoho dalších na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 22/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rekapitulace jarních vydání nejen linuxových distribucí: obvyklý Fedora Linux a Ubuntu tentokrát LTS s četnými deriváty, ale také KANOTIX, IPFire, Clonezilla live, NetBSD, EndeavourOS, TrueNAS SCALE, Tails, OSMC, Proxmox, RISC OS či metadistribuce T2 SDE.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 16-17/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Studie HP Wolf Security odhaluje aktuálně využívané metody kyberútoků. Acer představuje svůj první Copilot+ notebook Swift 14 s umělou inteligencí. Fortinet představuje prvního bezpečnostního asistenta pro IoT s generativní umělou inteligencí. Dell Technologies představuje ochranu dat v multicloudu. Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 21/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Před 70 lety vznikl první křemíkový solární článek. Webbův dalekohled zachytil nejvzdálenější fúzi černých děr. Malé modulární jaderné reaktory se blíží do Česka. Z čeho se skládá kosmické záření. Nový výzkum spojuje kyslík s technologickou civilizací.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Neutronové molekuly – neutrony se mohou vázat na kvantové tečky

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trh se službami cloudové infrastruktury zaznamenává již druhé čtvrtletí vyšší než očekávaný růst. Kyberzločinci zneužívají nové zranitelnosti o 43 % rychleji než před rokem. Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI. Pure Storage a Red Hat urychlují zavádění moderní virtualizace v podnicích. Nová služba Acronis MDR s integrovanou obnovou po útoku.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 20/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Další teorie se chce obejít bez temné hmoty i energie. Grafenový inkoust pro levný a dostupný tisk senzorů. Navrhli novou metodu detekce prvních hvězd. Změřili gravitaci blízko kvantovému světu. HPE postavila nejvýkonnější superpočítač v Polsku.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Působivá simulace pádu do černé díry

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: MicroPython (Wikipedie), tj. implementace Pythonu 3 optimalizovaná pro jednočipové počítače, byl vydán ve verzi 1.23.0. V přehledu novinek je vypíchnuta podpora dynamických USB zařízení nebo nové moduly openamp, tls a vfs.
articles.title: MicroPython 1.23.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Canonical vydal Ubuntu Core 24. Představení na YouTube. Nová verze Ubuntu Core vychází z Ubuntu 24.04 LTS a podporována bude 12 let. Ubuntu Core je určeno pro IoT (internet věcí) a vestavěné systémy.
articles.title: Ubuntu Core 24

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Databáze DuckDB (Wikipedie) dospěla po 6 letech do verze 1.0.0.
articles.title: DuckDB 1.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Intel na veletrhu Computex 2024 představil (YouTube) mimo jiné procesory Lunar Lake a Xeon 6.
articles.title: Intel na veletrhu Computex 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na blogu Raspberry Pi byl představen Raspberry Pi AI Kit určený vlastníkům Raspberry Pi 5, kteří na něm chtějí experimentovat se světem neuronových sítí, umělé inteligence a strojového učení. Jedná se o spolupráci se společností Hailo. Cena AI Kitu je 70 dolarů.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi AI Kit

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 14.1 svobodného unixového operačního systému FreeBSD. Podrobný přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Kaspersky vydala svůj bezplatný Virus Removal Tool (KVRT) také pro Linux.
articles.title: Kaspersky Virus Removal Tool (KVRT) také pro Linux

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Grafický editor dokumentů LyX, založený na TeXu, byl vydán ve verzi 2.4.0 shrnující změny za šest let vývoje. Novinky zahrnují podporu Unicode jako výchozí, export do ePub či DocBook 5 a velké množství vylepšení uživatelského rozhraní a prvků editoru samotného (např. rovnic, tabulek, citací).
articles.title: LyX 2.4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána (𝕏) nová verze 7.0 LTS open source monitorovacího systému Zabbix (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v oznámení na webu, v poznámkách k vydání a v aktualizované dokumentaci.
articles.title: Zabbix 7.0 LTS

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Organizace Apache Software Foundation (ASF) vydala verzi 22 integrovaného vývojového prostředí a vývojové platformy napsané v Javě NetBeans (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek na GitHubu. Instalovat lze také ze Snapcraftu a Flathubu.
articles.title: Apache NetBeans 22

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A few weeks ago NVIDIA introduced their much anticipated R555 beta driver with NVIDIA 555.42.02 for Linux bringing Wayland explicit sync support, the GPU System Processor (GSP) firmware being used by default, and a variety of Wayland improvements. Today the NVIDIA 555.52.04 beta driver is out that offers additional fixes for the R555 series...
articles.title: NVIDIA 555.52.04 Beta Linux Driver Brings Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2022 the KDE project laid out new goals to improve accessibility, develop more environmentally sustainable software, and automate more processes for easing the development of KDE. These overarching KDE Goals are refined every 2~3 years and they are now soliciting ideas from the community for what they should focus on ahead...
articles.title: KDE Is Soliciting Ideas For Their Goals To Pursue Over The Next 2~3 Years

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The latest performance optimization work for the Linux kernel's Device Mapper (DM) comes thanks to Red Hat's Mikulas Patocka...
articles.title: Linux 6.11 Device Mapper Will Optimize Flushing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel released a new version of its NPU Acceleration Library, the user-space Python library for leveraging the Neural Processing Unit (NPU) found within their Core Ultra "Meteor Lake" laptops and upcoming Lunar Lake and Arrow Lake hardware as well...
articles.title: Intel NPU Library v1.2 Adds Int4 Support & Performance Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off last month's AMDVLK 2024.Q2.1 driver adding Phoenix 2 support, AMD today released AMDVLK 2024.Q2.2 as the newest update to their official open-source Vulkan Linux driver...
articles.title: AMDVLK 2024.Q2.2 Driver Brings Bug Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Well, it's been a wild ride to say the least... Today marks twenty years since I started Phoronix.com devoted to reviewing Linux hardware and ultimately enriching the Linux hardware experience with more benchmarks, open-source/Linux hardware news, and more over the years...
articles.title: Today Marks 20 Years Since Starting Phoronix For Linux Hardware Reviews & News

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: ROCm 6.1.2 is out today as the newest update to AMD's open-source GPU compute stack for Linux systems and with growing support for Windows Subsystem for Linux...
articles.title: AMD ROCm 6.1.2 Released With Fixes & Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Queued into the x86 platform drivers' "for-next" branch ahead of the Linux 6.11 kernel cycle is the "Dell PC Extras" driver. Initially this new dell-pc driver is used for controlling fan modes via the Platform Profile setting on capable systems...
articles.title: Dell "PC Extras" Driver Slated For Linux 6.11 - Initially To Control Fan Modes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building atop the Intel "ANV" Vulkan driver's mesh shader support that's been enabled by default since last year, the newest Mesa 24.2-devel code as of today now adds support for mesh shader queries...
articles.title: Intel's Open-Source Vulkan Driver Wires Up Mesh Shader Queries

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in April I noted that Fedora was considering replacing Redis with Valkey given the upstream Redis software licensing changes. At yesterday's Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee (FESCo) they have now signed off on replacing Redis with Valkey...
articles.title: Fedora Moves Ahead In Replacing Redis With Valkey

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: IBM compiler engineers are ready to flip-on their POWER11 support within the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) in wiring up the "-mcpu=power11" option...
articles.title: IBM Ready With POWER11 Support "-mcpu=power11" For GCC

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: John Ogness of Linutronix today sent out the second iteration of his patches working on threaded printing support for printk() and related rework of that code that is a necessary step before the real-time (RT) kernel patches can be finally mainlined...
articles.title: Updated Printk Rework Patches - Necessary Step For Mainlining Linux Real-Time "RT"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Raspberry Pi teamed up with Hailo to develop the Raspberry Pi AI Kit as a $70 add-on for the Raspberry Pi 5 that offers a 13 TOPS AI accelerator module...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi AI Kit Launches For $70 For 13 TOPS AI Inference

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: FreeBSD 14.1-RELEASE is now available as the newest stable release to this leading BSD operating system. There are a number of package updates, new features, and expanded hardware support to find with FreeBSD 14.1...
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1 Released With Performance Improvements, OpenZFS Upgrade & Better Sound

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Intel's launch today of the Xeon 6700E series processors formerly codenamed Sierra Forest I am now able to share benchmarks of these new E-core server processors. Here is an initial look at the Intel Sierra Forest Linux performance using the Xeon 6766E and Xeon 6780E 144-core server processors in both single and dual socket configurations compared to prior Intel Xeon processors and the AMD EPYC competition.
articles.title: Intel Xeon 6780E / Xeon 6766E 144-Core Performance Benchmarks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel is using Computex 2024 for announcing the first Xeon 6 processors, which are the E-Core Sierra Forest models that initially are available in up to 144 cores per socket. Intel is also using Computex to shed more light on the Gaudi 3 AI accelerator and the upcoming P core Xeon 6 Granite Rapids processors and the later launch of the Xeon 6900E models with up to 288 cores per socket.
articles.title: Intel Launches Xeon 6700E Sierra Forest CPUs - Initially Up To 144 Cores

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: 24 hours ago AMD was in the limelight in announcing the Ryzen 9000 series, the Ryzen AI 300 series, teasing AMD 5th Gen EPYC, etc. Now the tables have turned to Intel with the embargo lifting concerning new details on the Gaudi 3 AI accelerator and upcoming Lunar Lake mobile processors and the launch of the Intel Xeon 6700E (Sierra Forest) E-core server processors. In this article is a look at some of the new disclosures around Lunar Lake...
articles.title: Intel Reveals New Lunar Lake Details At Computex

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AMD is hiring engineers to work on build and packaging of their "AMD Unified Linux Driver" to enhance the experience of deploying their packaged graphics driver stack -- including ROCm -- across different Linux distributions...
articles.title: AMD Hiring To Improve Their Linux Driver/ROCm Installation Process Across Distributions

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: On Wednesday, 5 June, marks 20 years since I started Phoronix.com for covering the Linux hardware ecosystem! It's sure been a long and tough journey with more remarks I'll reserve for Wednesday, but given the two decade mark, there's a Phoronix Premium special for those wishing to mark the special occasion and help ensure the site's healthy continuance into the next decade...
articles.title: Phoronix Turns 20 Years Old This Week - Celebrate With A Premium Special

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Rust-written Redox OS operating system issued their May monthly status report to highlight the various improvements made to this original open-source OS...
articles.title: Rust-Written Redox OS Continues Gravitating Toward The COSMIC Desktop

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Debian developer Luca Boccassi has begun working on systemd-boot support for using it as an alternative to the GRUB bootloader...
articles.title: Debian Seeing Work To Support systemd-boot

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux Mint project is out with its monthly newsletter that highlights recent progress made on this Ubuntu (and Debian) derived, desktop-focused Linux distribution. In May they worked out enhancements to Linux Mint's software manager and also continued working on optimizing their package archive hosting...
articles.title: Linux Mint Disabling Unverified Flatpaks By Default

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the in-development Linux 6.10 kernel Eric Biggers of Google landed new AES-XTS implementations for much faster performance for Intel/AMD processors via new AES-NI + AVX, VAES + AVX2, VAES + AVX10/256, and VAES + AVX10/512 code paths. Biggers has since begun tackling even better AES-GCM encryption/decryption performance by leveraging a new code path to utilize AVX-512/AVX10 and/or VAES...
articles.title: Up To 162% Faster AES-GCM Encryption/Decryption For Intel & AMD CPUs On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The latest feature work around Intel's Advanced Performance Extensions (APX) that is merged for the in-development GCC 15 compiler is supporting APX NF functionality for suppressing the update of status flags on arithmetic operations...
articles.title: GCC 15 Merges Support For Intel APX NF

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenCV 4.10 is out today as the newest version of the Open Computer Vision Library for this widely-used library with machine learning support, object detection, segmentation and recognition, motion video tracking, gesture recognition, and a variety of other features important for today's diverse workloads...
articles.title: OpenCV 4.10 Released With Many DNN Improvements, Wayland Backend For Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Arguably most exciting out of AMD's slew of Computex 2024 announcements is finally making official the Ryzen 9000 "Granite Ridge" processors built atop the new Zen 5 cores...
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9000 Series Announced - Zen 5 Showing Big Generational Uplift

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to all of the AMD client-side news during Lisa Su's keynote at Computex 2024 (see AMD Ryzen 9000 Series and AMD's Ryzen AI 300 Series Mobile APUs), the AMD CEO also teased the upcoming 5th Gen EPYC processors. AMD 5th Gen EPYC "Turin" processors are still on the way for releasing in H2'2024...
articles.title: AMD Previews 5th Gen EPYC With Up To 192 Cores Per Socket

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to announcing the AMD Ryzen 9000 series desktop processors powered by Zen 5, Lisa Su at Computex 2024 also announced the AMD Ryzen AI 300 series as the next-generation mobile processors powered by Zen 5 CPU cores while sporting RDNA 3.5 (also referred to as RDNA 3+ and RDNA3 refresh) integrated graphics and an XDNA 2 NPU...
articles.title: AMD's Ryzen AI 300 Series Mobile APUs Should Be Interesting For Next-Gen Laptops

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: At Computex 2024, AMD confirmed the Instinct MI325X will be released in Q4'2024 as the successor to the MI300X accelerator. Next year will be the AMD Instinct MI350 series based on the new CFNA 4 architecture. AMD is committing to an annual Instinct accelerator roadmap moving forward as they further up their AI game...

Almost every mission in Helldivers 2 is fun as long as you're with a squad that plays the objective and doesn't actively try to kill you. However, that fun can dissipate quickly when it comes to extraction, the simplest part of any mission that often causes the most issues. 


Extraction from a mission in Helldivers 2 shouldn't be difficult, but it is more often than not. You might end up missing the Pelican by one second because you were halfway across the map when the timer started, another player could accidentally kill you with a Stratagem, or you might run out of ammo while defending the extraction point. Thankfully, one player has put together an instruction video on extraction etiquette that should make all of these pain points a thing of the past. 


Follow these simple extraction …
articles.title: Helldivers 2 player tries to educate others on extraction etiquette with helpful how-to video

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
This year's major international tournament is right around the corner, and that means a massive new patch is on the way for EA FC 24. Here's when you can get your hands on the Euro 2024 update. 


If you're a long-time FIFA fan, you'll remember the incredible World Cup and Euros modes that EA used to drop. Back in the day, they were essentially an additional Ultimate Team, allowing you to build a squad of the best players at the competition. 


EA Sports has been unusually quiet about what the Euro 2024 patch will include, but we finally know when we'll be able to jump into the game and play it. 


Could this be Ronaldo's last major tournament for Portugal? Image via EA Sports


EA FC 24 Euro 2024 update release date


EA Sports FC 24's Euro 2024 update will be released on Thursday, June 6, 2024. This was confirmed by EA Sports themselves on June 4, telling players to "get ready for a festival of football."




EA FC 24 Euro 2024 update countdown


Unfortunately, EA Sports hasn't given us an exact time of when the update will go live in-game. Most content updates, such as Team of the Week, go live at 6 pm UK time, so we've set the countdown timer below to that time. We'll be sure to update it if we get any new information. 



What's included in EA FC 24's Euro 2024 update?


Truthfully, we don't know. EA Sports have been pretty secretive and not announced anything to do with the promo. We expect that it will be linked to Ultimate Team, and likely feature new cards based on players competing in the tournament. 


The promo image shows Euro 2024 players including Jude Bellingham and Virgil Van Dijk standing in their new kits for the tournament, so we expect those to be updated too. 


It's also possible we'll see updates to the tournament mode offline too, perhaps with the official graphics package that will be used in this year's edition of the European Championship. 

The post When does EA FC 24’s Euro 2024 update release? Countdown appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: When does EA FC 24’s Euro 2024 update release? Countdown

articles.author: Matt Porter
articles.description:
New weapons always dominate the Modern Warfare 3 meta at launch, but players have already had enough of Season 4's Kar98k sniper rifle, and are begging Sledgehammer to nerf it. 


Season 4 has already seen CoD fans complain about Sledgehammer making old guns useless, but the other side of that coin is that when they drop a new weapon, it's often so powerful that it becomes the game's most picked gun and is far too powerful. 


That's the opinion that many have of the Kar98k right now, with riversub calling the weapon "a menace" and "the definition of overpowered" on Reddit. 


A welcome return. Image via Activision


"Yep, one-tap weapons should be high risk, high reward, but nearly all of them in this game aren't," agreed Grand-Article4214. "There are barely any risks for snipers, especially since they aren't balanced to 150 health compared to every other gun in the game."


Icy-Computer7556 explained that they feel the gun has "ridiculous aim assist," stating: "Anything with one-shot potential close or far should instantly be aim assist free. They did that in previous CoDs and it worked well. Skilled players kept sniping and sh*tters gave up because they realized they didn't have the skill to just bloop everyone every second. I'm not saying I'm a good sniper, but the fact that it can slow down or pull on a gun like that? It's f**king crazy."


For some though, the idea of nerfing the Kar98k is pointless because something else will take its place, with conanwongmkii writing: "It's either the Kar98k, the Wardens, or the MORS sniper. Pick your poison, you can't escape it."


Personally, I find the Kar98k to be unbelievable in other people's hands, but in mine it feels like I get nothing but hitmarkers. I've never been a great sniper though, so it may be my fault. Still, getting one-shot killed over and over again by people running the Kar98k is infuriating, and I'd love to see some balancing changes too.

The post MW3 players are begging Sledgehammer to nerf ‘broken’ Kar98k appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: MW3 players are begging Sledgehammer to nerf ‘broken’ Kar98k

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
EA Sports has announced an EA FC 24 maintenance, which will take place on June 5.


This maintenance comes at a time when the Ultimate TOTS promo is still active in the Ultimate Team mode. However, EA Sports has some big plans for the upcoming weeks, and this server update might be in preparation for that. Among other possible content going live in the future, a separate Euro 2024 tournament is also expected by the fans. But before that, the community will have to bear with the upcoming update.


When will the EA FC 24 maintenance (June 5) begin?


EA Sports has officially announced details of the upcoming maintenance on the game's official X account. According to that post, the servers will be taken down at 8 a.m. UTC/1 a.m. PDT/4 a.m. ET, and matchmaking across all game modes will be stopped 30 minutes prior to that.


This maintenance will apply to the game across all platforms. However, only EA FC 24 will be impacted by this update, so those of you still playing older releases like FIFA 23 can continue to play without any worry.




When will the EA FC 24 maintenance (June 5) end?


The servers will be restored once the maintenance is concluded. As per the available schedule, June 5's maintenance will end at 2 p.m. UTC/7 a.m.PDT/10 a.m. ET. If there are no more delays, the servers will be down for approximately six hours. This is certainly one of the longer server maintenance periods in recent times.


While the maintenance is live, players won't be able to access game modes like Ultimate Team, which rely on online matchmaking. Career Mode will remain a playable option, as there's no need for the internet to conduct matches.

The post EA FC 24 maintenance (June 5): When will the servers come back appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: EA FC 24 maintenance (June 5): When will the servers come back

Clorinde is a 5-star Electro DPS character in Genshin Impact, and the second character ever to incorporate Bond of Life mechanics in their kit. Here’s a breakdown of Clorinde’s unique kit and how to play her.


What is Bond of Life?


First, a quick explanation of Bond of Life. Bond of Life is a debuff that restricts the healing that a character can receive by a flat amount. The amount of Bond of Life that you have is represented by a red bar surrounding the affected character’s health bar. If that character receives healing while a Bond of Life is present, the Bond of Life will absorb that healing instead of allowing your character’s HP to be restored.

articles.author: Jonathan LoChiatto
articles.description:
Some players are realizing, as they delve into The Final Shape campaign in Destiny 2, that they don't have access to the new Prismatic Subclass when they should. As it turns out, this is a bug Bungie has already acknowledged, and a fix is readily available. That said, the workaround solution does require a little extra effort from affected players.


Destiny 2 expansion launches, as with many MMO expansion launches, are frequently filled with long waits due to player influx and error codes. While Bungie tries to make errors a bit lighthearted by naming them Plum or Honeydew, these sometimes time-consuming network or population issues can be annoying. That said,  once players actually get into the game, frustrations typically subside. That's not the case with this Prismatic bug, as it prevents players from acquiring the Subclass, which is needed throughout the campaign.


How to get Prismatic if missed


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you realize that you've completed the first campaign mission in The Final Shape and don't have access to the Prismatic Subclass, you'll have to replay that first mission once more. Additionally, you'll need to go it alone to ensure things play out properly the second time around. While this may not be the news affected players want to hear, the bright side is that there is a solution, and all it requires is a little more time.


Of course, the best option is to hope to circumvent the issue altogether. For the best results, players shouldn't try joining other players while the mission is in progress or start it with players who already have the new Subclass. If players aren't sure if their run is affected, they'll know for sure if there isn't a large Prismatic interactable just before approaching the Rally flag for the final encounter.

The post What to do if you don’t get Prismatic after the first Destiny 2: The Final Shape mission appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What to do if you don’t get Prismatic after the first Destiny 2: The Final Shape mission

Once the update is live, Yinlin can be pulled from her Resonator Convene event, When Thunder Pours. Like any other gacha game, it won't always be guaranteed, so it may take a few tries.


Based on Yinlin's artwork, she is a 5-star character who harnesses Electro powers. She was once a Jinzhou patroller, but now her position remains a mystery. What we do know, however, is that she excels in uncovering crimes using her exploitative skills. She also has been known to have a "heart of gold" as long as she deems people trustworthy.


Although Yinlin has yet to make it to Wuthering Waves, many players are preparing for her debut with Ascension materials. This includes items like the Unwarranted Feather and the Group Abomination Tacet Core. So, if you want to prepare for her launch, ensure you've collected these materials for fast character upgrades.
